intro: Obeliscotheca ampla, commonly known as the giant cupuaçu, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to cacao pods, containing a sweet, creamy pulp. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ecological importance and potential economic value, it is a subject of interest for conservation and agricultural research.
